title: "If It Looks Stupid, But Works, It Wasn't Stupid."
body:
Some of you may not remember, but AP Shaco was seen as almost (almost) one of the most 'Trollish' ways to build the champion. Incidentally more and more realized it worked, until even RIOT simply made him a melee mage. The Meta changes all the time, and normally starts with some 'idiot, noob, bronze' player that realizes a new way to abuse a mechanic. 

The point here is if a teammate starts building something, just let them build it. Feel free to condemn them if it fails. (I said condemn, not flame.) Report them if it makes you feel better. What ever you do, the following is being done to the point that I no longer blame some players for simply walking away from their keyboards:

- Spam Pinging their items for the entire game. They should not go without teamwork just because you're an ass.
- Intentionally trying to get them killed. Enough carrying Zilean bombs to them, Headbutting enemies at them, or other such childish crap that should get **you** banned immediately. 
- Melting down into a foam mouthed rage fit in chat. They will likely just ignore you, report you, and for good reason.
- All around douchebaggery.

Enough with that crap. I know your mommy told you that you are special, and you can say and do what you wish, but this is the real world. Tired of seeing Ban Appeals because you are a jackass.

As a replacement for ADC? Why Katarina? For the passive resets?
I feel like a ranged mage would have a better time in lane, with waveclear and/or duo lane synergy. Ziggs (with tower pushing), Brand (with bouncing ult), or maybe even Swain (with the passive pull on support's CC) could work well.

But then, if you had successes before, please share some tips! I'm always down to try an unconventional picks, especially for bot lane.

The reason is due to Katarina's nature as a champion.  As an assassin battle mage hybrid, she provides massive sustained aoe damage.  
In addition since she is designed to chain kills together she is able to easily snowball off two squishy laners.  If one die they basically both do.
And her lack of mana os a huge boost to the lane's sustain.

Of course the main reason I do it is because at level 9 when I first bought her, I played her in intermediate bots, solo bot lane.  So my playstyle with her is adapted bottom lane, although the choreography on her passive did hurt her quite a bit.

Its actually a great lane, her best partners are Akali, Nautilus and Soraka.  But like I said Leonas and (good)Zyras fuck you up the ass.

{{champion:81}} blue build was pioneered by a gold player is the most famous example I can think of.
In Season 1 it was argued that Singed was honestly not very viable for tournament play... and then there was Laugh Spamming Dyrus.

Dude there was even the Strength of ~~Spirit~~ Singed rune, RoA and a few other tricks that when used together actually warranted targeted nerfs because of how broken they really were back then.  I was a TT player back then, but absolutely loved Singed, Kassadin, and Ryze, the OG manastackers, and well, they simply had it too good back then, but no one took the time to figure out how to get the most out of them ~~coughRstackingManadincough~~ until someone else popularized a previous "troll" build.

Another example, though a tad off topic, was the tactic of starting all wards against bots while taking rally and fortify.  Fortify would passively give AD, and rally helped you take towers faster by AoE buffing AD and attack speed, additionally, wards were prioritized over champions by tower so you could keep dropping them to tank tower aggro and essentially free push down the nexus for safe and easy ip/exp farming in under 5 minutes.  Sounded totally troll, and might look like an int feeder from the start, but then it ends up being the most efficient strategy.
^This strategy would work against players as well, by the way, but they would react and respond well before you got to the nexus.  In essence you could have as little as 2-3 champs start like this and cheese down a single tower with only one person taking rally, but it wasn't really worth the starting gold you'd give up on 2-3 people just for a single tower.

If it looks stupid, but works, you got LUCKY.

AP Shaco was a very niche, off meta build for him that was little more than a gimmick. Riot just added in ways for that to evolve into more than a gimmick, but that still doesn't mean that people who originally ran it years ago weren't lucky it worked.

There is a distinct difference in "they were lucky," and "their play style worked with the build."

If we are all to be robots, never building outside of the Meta, RIOT may as well take away the store and just give items via time table+kills+assists.

Their play style only worked because of luck. They were lucky because other players built ARMOR and not MAGIC RESIST against a traditionally AD assassin, and that's why AP Shaco was able to be effective. No one, not even today, builds heavy MR against Shaco. 
When Riot saw that AP Shaco was becoming popular because it's effective against people who aren't trained to build MR against Shaco, they began adding in more avenues for AP to be relevant in his kit.
So it was definitely 100% luck that people didn't start building MR against AP Shaco when it was first a thing.

This post REALLY isn't about Shaco. You do know that, right? Also you have to build both against Shaco. (Armor and MR). All of his skills scale on AP, but half do physical, half do magical. Just saying.

Yes, I get that this post isn't about Shaco. But I was explaining why AP Shaco only became a thing because it was based on luck. Going AP Shaco back when it wasn't a completely meta or viable build for him was still considered kind of stupid.

Same goes for off meta stuff tried today. It can still be stupid, even if it works, because in 90% of the cases, you got lucky because it worked. I've done Caitlyn and Jinx support before and won. They worked in those games. Does that make them any less stupid? No, I went in knowing what I was doing was dumb and for fun. I just got lucky that the opponents were thrown so off guard by it that I was able to take the advantage.

That's generally what happens, however, in a game with such a linear minded community. I rush a revolver on MF,  primarily because they assume I am trolling as AP... until I finally shoot THEM and they realize it stacks with her passive, and the Slow and Healing from gunblade is simply nice... and it amps her ultimate.

Point is it works for me. I like playing my ADCs for opening burst so hard they instinctively try to run - followed by massive sustain to ignore their team as I focus them down.

I mainly play ARAM (which I feel is a Kamikaze version of Hyper SR Lte) and often get team mates that main SR. Just 2 days ago I got the question, "How the h*ll does an AP item help Xayah?!?" (I built Rylai's). Well, not at all...except for CC from its slow. We had 2 ADC's and were heading into a loss mid-game. I figured 2 tanks, 2 ADCs and Vieg...f-it, I'm going "supp" ADC. I already had 2 damage/crit items and AS so why not capitalize on setting up kills. Totally worked. Enemy team was confused, didn't know how they were being slowed from so far away and we won :)

Been playing League (like I said, mainly ARAM) since 2012 and three years into it I decided, "This is Aram, there is no meta. Do what it takes to win." Don't get me wrong, I personally would NVR go into SR with that belief unless (like others have stated) I fully tested the build in a normal first and no, it doesn't work out 100% of the time (correct runes are key) but boy does it feel good when you pull it off.
